pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru

related.meaning: advance (into a new market, industry, etc.)
advancing to the next stage of education

lessons.japanese: 会社は昇進で彼の業績に報いた。
lessons.english: The company rewarded him with promotion.

lessons.japanese: ジャネットが昇進するみたいよ。
lessons.english: It looks like Janet's going to be kicked upstairs.

lessons.japanese: この会社では昇進の見込みがない。
lessons.english: Chances of promotion are slim in this firm.

lessons.japanese: あなたは、どんなに有能であっても、昇進しないだろう。
lessons.english: No matter how capable you are, you're not going to get a promotion.

lessons.japanese: あなたの昇進は時機を得た、当然なものだと思います。
lessons.english: I am sure your promotion was timely and well deserved.
My father was promoted to president.

lessons.japanese: 秘書が昇進を求めているんです。
lessons.english: My secretary is pushing for a promotion.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は先輩を追い越して昇進した。
lessons.english: She was promoted over the heads of her seniors.

lessons.japanese: 彼女はこの会社に入ってから２度昇進した。
lessons.english: She has been promoted twice since she joined this company.

lessons.japanese: 彼女の夫は、昇進出来なかったので、５５歳で退職した。
lessons.english: Her husband, having failed to obtain promotion, retired at the age of 55.

lessons.japanese: 彼らは先輩に昇進おめでとうと言った。
lessons.english: They congratulated their 'sempai' on his promotion.

lessons.japanese: 彼らは先輩に昇進おめでとうと言った。
lessons.english: They congratulated their colleague on his promotion.
